description: Lenart Kova gains access to a buried audit log exposing years of BCI erasures and betrayals, but decides instead to erase it, prioritizing a chance at collective redemption over exposure of past wrongs.
Lenart activates the dormant Council broadcast node. The system prepares a citywide message using Halden’s pre-recorded address, while any trace of the audit log is permanently deleted.

Halden’s address appears on networks citywide, revealing the inner workings of the BCI and offering a stark civic choice: restore the system, build a new framework, or dismantle automated rule. The public is invited to debate and vote.
A citywide, secure referendum is held. Citizens participate openly, voting on the core question of BCI’s future and the structure of governance.
Referendum results show a decisive vote for transparent, assembly-driven governance and a permanent sunset of the BCI system. Stenograd enters a new era of collective rule and direct democracy.
